title: Alexander Jun
text:
Alexander Jun is an American academic and Presbyterian official. He is a professor of Higher Education at <a href="Azusa%20Pacific%20University">Azusa Pacific University</a>, and former moderator of the <a href="Presbyterian%20Church%20in%20America">Presbyterian Church in America</a>. He was also the first-place winner of the 2020 Korean American ROAR Story Slam in Los Angeles, CA.
Early life.
Jun graduated from the University of Southern California with a bachelor's degree. He subsequently earned a master's degree from California State University, Los Angeles, and a PhD from the University of Southern California.
Career.
Jun was a faculty member at the University of Southern California for 15 years. He later joined Azusa Pacific University, where he became professor of Higher Education. He is the author of a book about Latinos in higher education, and the co-author of a second book about <a href="white%20privilege">white privilege</a>.
Jun was elected as the moderator of the Presbyterian Church in America in June 2017.
